name: (4E)-4-{[5-(4-nitrophenyl)furan-2-yl]methylidene}-2-phenyl-1,3-oxazol-5(4H)-one
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1194
Reason: The molecule has a complex structure with multiple functional groups, each of which can contribute to the melting point. The base structure of the molecule is an oxazole ring, which has a melting point of approximately -20°C. The nitro group can increase the melting point by approximately +60°C due to its polarity and ability to form hydrogen bonds. The phenyl group can also increase the melting point by approximately +60°C due to its planarity and increased molecular weight. The furan ring can increase the melting point by approximately +40°C due to its polarity and conjugation. The methylidene group can increase the melting point by approximately +20°C due to its increased molecular weight. The total estimated impact on the melting point from all functional groups is: -20 (base) + 60 (nitro group) + 60 (phenyl group) + 40 (furan ring) + 20 (methylidene group) = 190°C.
